Articles.Content:
Hey Everyone,

Some of the most exciting recent changes to KSP IMO have been the improved terrain for both the Mun and Kerbin. This gives me about a thousand new reasons to go exploring. I would love to see terrain in this game continue to evolve. I think cave systems would provide tons of immersion and encourage new and unique vehicle designs.

I know that cave systems would not be realistic in certain environments like moons, however any planet with liquid on it in the past (Duna) or present (Laythe and Kerbin) could benefit from it. Also i could see large caverns existing inside other celestial bodies due to impacts or deposit imbalances (Lava Tubes on Eve?)

It would be another awesome way to hide anomalies as well. Imagine finding the Kraken's body in a huge nested cave system! Not sure if this has been suggested before, just a thought.
Unfortunately, the way KSP handles planetary surfaces right now, (at least, caves the way you're describing them) are impossible. Cool idea, though.
Caves would be sweet. bear in mind this is not Minecraft, though. Caves, if they can be added, will not be as extensive as those. Perhaps 3 smalls caves per planet would be plausible in the future.

Unfortunately, the way KSP handles planetary surfaces right now, (at least, caves the way you're describing them) are impossible. Cool idea, though.

No curving back when represented by graphs. I think the proper name is bijective function? Every element of x is represented by only one y and vice versa?

Ive seen a basic cave done with the KerbTown mod. I know that minecraft style cave systems would be out of the question but a few shallow caves scattered around the landscape would make for interesting exploration and could possibly be worth extra "science/research" in the upcoming update.
